Transparency.justification: Score = 1 because 3 source(s) (listed below) contain detailed, verifiable information.

relevantSources.title: AI & Data Convergence - AbbVie
relevantSources.summary: AbbVie's analytics platform uses AI and machine learning to centralize data from 200+ sources.

relevantSources.title: Three ways AI is changing drug discovery at AbbVie
relevantSources.summary: Explores AI applications in drug discovery including ARCH platform for data convergence.

relevantSources.title: Transparency in Payments - AbbVie
relevantSources.summary: AbbVie demonstrates transparency in healthcare professional payments and relationships.

Transparency.findings: AbbVie provides detailed information about its AI platforms, data convergence efforts, and transparency in healthcare-related payments. These sources show the company’s commitment to making its AI and data practices visible and understandable to stakeholders.

Fairness & Bias Mitigation.justification: Score = 0.5 because 1 source(s) (listed below) contain only high-level principle statements.

relevantSources.title: Impact through Inclusion - AbbVie
relevantSources.summary: AbbVie's commitment to equity, equality, diversity and inclusion with focus on fairness.

Fairness & Bias Mitigation.findings: AbbVie publicly commits to principles of equity, equality, and inclusion, which are relevant to fairness and bias mitigation. However, there is no direct evidence of technical or procedural bias mitigation in AI systems.

Explainability.justification: Score = 1 because 2 source(s) (listed below) contain detailed, verifiable information.

relevantSources.title: Principal Scientist I, Computational Pathology, Precision Medicine Pathology
relevantSources.summary: Role involves developing interpretable AI approaches using explainable AI techniques for clinical validation.

relevantSources.title: Postdoctoral Fellow, Computer Vision
relevantSources.summary: Position requires experience with explainable AI solutions and representation learning methods.

Explainability.findings: AbbVie’s job postings for AI roles explicitly reference explainable AI techniques and the need for interpretable models, particularly in clinical and computer vision applications. This demonstrates a concrete focus on explainability in AI development.

relevantSources.title: (Senior) Natural Language Developer (AI/LLM)
relevantSources.summary: Position involves human-in-the-loop AI translation systems and oversight mechanisms.

Human Oversight & Accountability.findings: AbbVie’s documentation and job descriptions highlight the importance of accountability and human oversight in both business operations and AI system development. This includes explicit mention of human-in-the-loop processes for AI applications.

Privacy & Security.findings: AbbVie has dedicated roles for privacy and security in AI, including compliance program management and legal counsel. These sources show that privacy and security are actively managed in the context of AI and emerging technologies.

Governance & Accountability.justification: Score = 1 because 3 source(s) (listed below) contain detailed, verifiable information.

Governance & Accountability.findings: AbbVie has formal governance structures for AI, including executive-level roles and strategies for responsible AI implementation. These sources indicate a systematic approach to AI governance, data strategy, and ethical considerations.

relevantSources.title: Associate Director, Audit Analytics & Automation

Public Commitments & External Audits.findings: AbbVie references the use of AI in internal audit and compliance processes. However, there is no public evidence of external audits or formal public commitments specific to responsible AI.

summary.overallFindings: AbbVie demonstrates strong responsible AI practices in transparency, explainability, human oversight, privacy, and governance, supported by detailed evidence from public sources and job descriptions. The company has documented processes and roles focused on AI transparency, explainability, and compliance. However, there are gaps in public evidence regarding technical fairness and bias mitigation in AI systems, as well as external audits or explicit public commitments related to responsible AI. Overall, AbbVie shows a high level of maturity in most responsible AI pillars, with opportunities to strengthen fairness and external accountability.
